SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.sciss.jcollider
Class Buffer

java.lang.Object
  de.sciss.jcollider.Buffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants
public class Buffer
extends Object
implements Constants

Mimics SCLang's Buffer class, that is, it's a client side representation of an audio buffer

Version:
0.29, 17-Sep-06
Author:
Hanns Holger Rutz
Todo:
custom fill commands (sine1 etc.), allocReadChannel and readChannel methods
Warning:
this is a quick direct translation from SClang which is largely untested. before all methods have been thoroughly verified, excepted some of them to be wrong or behave different than expected. what certainly works is alloc-, read-, free-, zero- and close-messages

Nested Class Summary
static interface Buffer.CompletionAction
          Interface describing an action to take place after an asynchronous buffer command is completed.
static interface Buffer.CompletionFunction
          Interface describing an function that creates an OSC message used as a completion message in asynchronous buffer commands.

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Buffer

public Buffer(Server server,
              int numFrames,
              int numChannels)
Creates a new Buffer with given number of frames and channels. This method uses the Server's allocators but does not send an allocMsg to the server.

Parameters:
server - the server to which the buffer belongs
numFrames - the number of frames (samples per channel) that buffer occupies
numChannels - the number of channels the buffer occupies
See Also:
alloc()
Warning:
when the allocators are exhausted, the bufNum of the returned Buffer instance is -1. The caller is responsible for dealing with this possible failure.

Buffer

public Buffer(Server server,
              int numFrames,
              int numChannels,
              int bufNum)
Creates a new Buffer with given number of frames and channels. This method requires an explicit buffer index and does not use the Server's allocators. This method does not send an allocMsg to the server.

Parameters:
server - the server to which the buffer belongs
numFrames - the number of frames (samples per channel) that buffer occupies
numChannels - the number of channels the buffer occupies
bufNum - the index of the buffer
Method Detail

getServer

public Server getServer()
Queries the server at which the buffer resides

Returns:
the buffer's Server

getSampleRate

public double getSampleRate()
Queries the buffer data's sample rate. This rate is updated when an asynchronous read command is completed and buffer info has been received from the server.

Returns:
the buffer content's sample rate

setSampleRate

protected void setSampleRate(double sampleRate)

getBufNum

public int getBufNum()
Queries the buffer's index.

Returns:
the buffer index

getNumFrames

public int getNumFrames()
Queries the buffer data's number of frames (samples per channel). In ansynchronous allocation by read this value is filled in when the read is completed and buffer info has been received from the server.

Returns:
the number of frames in the buffer

setNumFrames

protected void setNumFrames(int numFrames)

getNumChannels

public int getNumChannels()
Queries the buffer's number of channels. In ansynchronous allocation by read this value is filled in when the read is completed and buffer info has been received from the server.

Returns:
the number of channels in the buffer

setNumChannels

protected void setNumChannels(int numChannels)

getPath

public String getPath()
Queries the buffer's sound file path. In ansynchronous allocation by read this value is instantely filled in.

Returns:
the sound file path of the buffer or null

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object

alloc

public static Buffer alloc(Server server,
                           int numFrames)
                    throws IOException
Allocates and returns a new mono Buffer with given number of frames.

Parameters:
server - the server to which the buffer belongs
numFrames - the number of frames (samples per channel) that buffer occupies
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message

alloc

public static Buffer alloc(Server server,
                           int numFrames,
                           int numChannels)
                    throws IOException
Allocates and returns a new Buffer with given number of channels and frames.

Parameters:
server - the server to which the buffer belongs
numFrames - the number of frames (samples per channel) that buffer occupies
numChannels - the number of channels the buffer occupies
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message

alloc

public static Buffer alloc(Server server,
                           int numFrames,
                           int numChannels,
                           Buffer.CompletionFunction completionFunc)
                    throws IOException
Allocates and returns a new Buffer with given number of channels and frames.

Parameters:
server - the server to which the buffer belongs
numFrames - the number of frames (samples per channel) that buffer occupies
numChannels - the number of channels the buffer occupies
completionFunc - a function that returns an OSCMessage which is processed by the server when the reading is complete. can be null.
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message

alloc

public static Buffer alloc(Server server,
                           int numFrames,
                           int numChannels,
                           Buffer.CompletionFunction completionFunc,
                           int bufNum)
                    throws IOException
Allocates and returns a new Buffer with given number of channels and frames. This uses an explicitly provided buffer index and not the server's allocator.

Parameters:
server - the server to which the buffer belongs
numFrames - the number of frames (samples per channel) that buffer occupies
numChannels - the number of channels the buffer occupies
completionFunc - a function that returns an OSCMessage which is processed by the server when the reading is complete. can be null.
bufNum - the index by which the buffer is known on the server
Returns:
the newly created Buffer
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message

allocRead

public void allocRead(String path,
                      long startFrame,
                      int numFrames)
               throws IOException
Allocates the buffer created with the basic new constructor, by reading in a sound file.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
startFrame - starting frame in the sound file
numFrames - the number of frames to read, which equals the number of frames allocated for the buffer
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
Buffer( Server, int, int )
Warning:
long startFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

                      long startFrame,
                      int numFrames,
                      OSCMessage completionMsg)
               throws IOException
Allocates the buffer created with the basic new constructor, by reading in a sound file.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
startFrame - starting frame in the sound file
numFrames - the number of frames to read, which equals the number of frames allocated for the buffer
completionMsg - an OSCMessage which is processed by the server when the allocation and reading is complete. can be null.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
Buffer( Server, int, int )
Warning:
long startFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public static Buffer read(Server server,
                          String path)
                   throws IOException
Reads a whole file into memory for PlayBuf etc. adds a query as a completion message.

Parameters:
server - the server on which the buffer is allocated
path - the path to the sound file
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message

read

public static Buffer read(Server server,
                          String path,
                          long startFrame)
                   throws IOException
Reads a whole file into memory for PlayBuf etc., starting at a given frame. adds a query as a completion message.

Parameters:
server - the server on which the buffer is allocated
path - the path to the sound file
startFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long startFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public static Buffer read(Server server,
                          String path,
                          long startFrame,
                          int numFrames)
                   throws IOException
Reads a section of a file into memory for PlayBuf etc. adds a query as a completion message.

Parameters:
server - the server on which the buffer is allocated
path - the path to the sound file
startFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read. this is equal to the number of frames allocated for the buffer
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long startFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public static Buffer read(Server server,
                          String path,
                          long startFrame,
                          int numFrames,
                          Buffer.CompletionAction action)
                   throws IOException
Reads a section of a file into memory for PlayBuf etc. adds a query as a completion message.

Parameters:
server - the server on which the buffer is allocated
path - the path to the sound file
startFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read. this is equal to the number of frames allocated for the buffer
action - an action to be executed when the /b_info message comes back from the server. at this time the buffer has been allocated and filled. action can be null
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long startFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public static Buffer read(Server server,
                          String path,
                          long startFrame,
                          int numFrames,
                          Buffer.CompletionAction action,
                          int bufNum)
                   throws IOException
Reads a section of a file into memory for PlayBuf etc. adds a query as a completion message. An explicit buffer index is provided.

Parameters:
server - the server on which the buffer is allocated
path - the path to the sound file
startFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read. this is equal to the number of frames allocated for the buffer
action - an action to be executed when the /b_info message comes back from the server. at this time the buffer has been allocated and filled. action can be null
bufNum - the index to use for the buffer
Returns:
the newly created buffer
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long startFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public void read(String path)
          throws IOException
Reads in as many frames from a sound file as fit into the buffer, starting at the beginning of the file. Closes the file after reading.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message

read

public void read(String path,
                 long fileStartFrame)
          throws IOException
Reads in as many frames from a sound file as fit into the buffer, starting at a given frame in the file. Closes the file after reading.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
fileStartFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long fileStartFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public void read(String path,
                 long fileStartFrame,
                 int numFrames)
          throws IOException
Reads in frames from a sound file into the buffer. Closes the file after reading.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
fileStartFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read a value of -1 indicates that as many frames as fit into the buffer should be read
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long fileStartFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public void read(String path,
                 long fileStartFrame,
                 int numFrames,
                 int bufStartFrame)
          throws IOException
Reads in frames from a sound file into the buffer, beginning a given offset in the buffer. Closes the file after reading.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
fileStartFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read a value of -1 indicates that as many frames as fit into the buffer should be read
bufStartFrame - the offset (in frames) in the buffer at which the filling begins
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long fileStartFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public void read(String path,
                 long fileStartFrame,
                 int numFrames,
                 int bufStartFrame,
                 boolean leaveOpen)
          throws IOException
Reads in frames from a sound file into the buffer, beginning a given offset in the buffer.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
fileStartFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read a value of -1 indicates that as many frames as fit into the buffer should be read
bufStartFrame - the offset (in frames) in the buffer at which the filling begins
leaveOpen - false to close the sound file after reading, true to leave it open (as required for a DiskIn UGen). If you leave the file open, don't forget to call close on the buffer eventually.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long fileStartFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

read

public void read(String path,
                 long fileStartFrame,
                 int numFrames,
                 int bufStartFrame,
                 boolean leaveOpen,
                 Buffer.CompletionAction action)
          throws IOException
Reads in frames from a sound file into the buffer, beginning a given offset in the buffer.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
fileStartFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read a value of -1 indicates that as many frames as fit into the buffer should be read
bufStartFrame - the offset (in frames) in the buffer at which the filling begins
leaveOpen - false to close the sound file after reading, true to leave it open (as required for a DiskIn UGen). If you leave the file open, don't forget to call close on the buffer eventually.
action - an action to be executed when the /b_info comes back from the server. at this moment, the read operation is completed.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
Warning:
long fileStartFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
Returns:
the message to be sent to the server

readMsg

                          long fileStartFrame,
                          int numFrames,
                          int bufStartFrame,
                          boolean leaveOpen,
                          OSCMessage completionMsg)
Creates an OSC /b_read message to read in frames from a sound file into the buffer, beginning a given offset in the buffer.

Parameters:
path - the path to the sound file
fileStartFrame - the frame index in the sound file to start reading from
numFrames - the number of frames to read a value of -1 indicates that as many frames as fit into the buffer should be read
bufStartFrame - the offset (in frames) in the buffer at which the filling begins
leaveOpen - false to close the sound file after reading, true to leave it open (as required for a DiskIn UGen). If you leave the file open, don't forget to call close on the buffer eventually.
completionMsg - an OSCMessage which is processed by the server when the reading is complete. can be null.
Returns:
the message to be sent to the server

long fileStartFrame is truncated to 32bit by OSCMessage for now

write

public void write(String path)
           throws IOException
Writes the buffer contents to a sound file, using AIFF integer 24 bit format.

Parameters:
path - the path name of the file to write to
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message

write

public void write(String path,
                  String headerFormat,
                  String sampleFormat)
           throws IOException
Writes the buffer contents to a sound file.

Parameters:
path - the path name of the file to write to
headerFormat - one of kHeaderAIFF etc.
sampleFormat - one of kSampleInt24 etc.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
Constants.kHeaderAIFF, Constants.kSampleInt24

write

public void write(String path,
                  String headerFormat,
                  String sampleFormat,
                  int numFrames)
           throws IOException
Writes the buffer contents to a sound file.

Parameters:
path - the path name of the file to write to
headerFormat - one of kHeaderAIFF etc.
sampleFormat - one of kSampleInt24 etc.
numFrames - to number of frames to write, or -1 to write the whole buffer
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
Constants.kHeaderAIFF, Constants.kSampleInt24

write

public void write(String path,
                  String headerFormat,
                  String sampleFormat,
                  int numFrames,
                  int bufStartFrame)
           throws IOException
Writes a section of the buffer to a sound file.

Parameters:
path - the path name of the file to write to
headerFormat - one of kHeaderAIFF etc.
sampleFormat - one of kSampleInt24 etc.
numFrames - to number of frames to write, or -1 to write the whole buffer
bufStartFrame - the start frame in the buffer from which to write
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
Constants.kHeaderAIFF, Constants.kSampleInt24

write

public void write(String path,
                  String headerFormat,
                  String sampleFormat,
                  int numFrames,
                  int bufStartFrame,
                  boolean leaveOpen)
           throws IOException
Writes a section of the buffer to a sound file.

Parameters:
path - the path name of the file to write to
headerFormat - one of kHeaderAIFF etc.
sampleFormat - one of kSampleInt24 etc.
numFrames - to number of frames to write, or -1 to write the whole buffer
bufStartFrame - the start frame in the buffer from which to write
leaveOpen - false to close the sound file after writing, true to leave it open (as required for a DiskOut UGen). If you leave the file open, don't forget to call close on the buffer eventually.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
Constants.kHeaderAIFF, Constants.kSampleInt24

write

public void write(String path,
                  String headerFormat,
                  String sampleFormat,
                  int numFrames,
                  int bufStartFrame,
                  boolean leaveOpen,
                  OSCMessage completionMsg)
           throws IOException
Writes a section of the buffer to a sound file.

Parameters:
path - the path name of the file to write to
headerFormat - one of kHeaderAIFF etc.
sampleFormat - one of kSampleInt24 etc.
numFrames - to number of frames to write, or -1 to write the whole buffer
bufStartFrame - the start frame in the buffer from which to write
leaveOpen - false to close the sound file after writing, true to leave it open (as required for a DiskOut UGen). If you leave the file open, don't forget to call close on the buffer eventually.
completionMsg - an OSCMessage which is processed by the server when the writing is complete. can be null.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
Constants.kHeaderAIFF, Constants.kSampleInt24

readNoUpdate

public static Buffer readNoUpdate(Server server,
                                  String path)
                           throws IOException
Reads a whole file into memory for PlayBuf etc. Just like read( Server, String ) but without sending a /b_query. Hence, the internal fields are not updated unless you explicitly call query()

Parameters:
server - the server on which the buffer is allocated
path - the path to the sound file
Returns:
the newly created Buffer or null if the server's buffer allocator is exhausted
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while sending the OSC message
See Also:
read( Server, String )

                                  String path,

                           throws IOException

                           throws IOException

server - the server on which the buffer is allocated

completionFunc - an action to be executed when the /b_info message comes back from the server. at this time the buffer has been allocated and filled. action can be null

the newly created buffer

freeAll

public static void freeAll(Server server)
                    throws IOException
Frees all known buffers on a server. Known buffers are those which were allocated regularly using the server's buffer allocator.

Parameters:
server - the server whose buffers should be freed
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs in OSC bundle sending

query

public void query()
           throws IOException
A debugging method for querying the current buffer parameters and printing them into the console. This sends a query message to the server and upon reply prints the current buffer parameters into the console (as defined by server.setPrintStream()).

Throws:
IOException - if a networking error occurs
Todo:
this simply waits for the next /b_info message to come in without checking the bufNum ; also there is no time out

queryMsg

public OSCMessage queryMsg()
Constructs an OSC message /b_query for querying the buffer's parameters.

Returns:
the OSC message, ready to be send to the server

updateInfo

public void updateInfo(Buffer.CompletionAction action)
                throws IOException
Asynchronously updates the buffer parameters (such as number of frames or sample rate). It sends a query message to the server and upon reply, executes a given completion action.

Parameters:
action - the action to be executed once the buffer info is updated
Throws:
IOException - if a networking error occurs

printOn

public void printOn(PrintStream stream)

play

public Synth play()
           throws IOException
Plays the buffer contents (oneshot) beginning on the first audio output.

Returns:
the buffer playing synth. the synth is automatically freed when the buffer playback is complete.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs in message sending
Warning:
requires prior UGenInfo.readDefinitions

play

public Synth play(boolean loop)
           throws IOException
Plays the buffer contents beginning on the first audio output.

Parameters:
loop - whether the playback should be looped or not.
Returns:
the buffer playing synth. when not looping, the synth is automatically freed when the buffer playback is complete.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs in message sending
Warning:
requires prior UGenInfo.readDefinitions

play

public Synth play(boolean loop,
                  float amp)
           throws IOException
Plays the buffer contents beginning on the first audio output.

Parameters:
loop - whether the playback should be looped or not.
amp - the amplitude scaling
Returns:
the buffer playing synth. when not looping, the synth is automatically freed when the buffer playback is complete.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs in message sending
Warning:
requires prior UGenInfo.readDefinitions

play

public Synth play(boolean loop,
                  float amp,
                  int outBus)
           throws IOException
Plays the buffer contents.

Parameters:
loop - whether the playback should be looped or not.
amp - the amplitude scaling
outBus - the index of the first bus to play on
Returns:
the buffer playing synth. when not looping, the synth is automatically freed when the buffer playback is complete.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs in message sending
Warning:
requires prior UGenInfo.readDefinitions

play

public Synth play(boolean loop,
                  float amp,
                  int outBus,
                  float fadeTime)
           throws IOException
Plays the buffer contents.

Parameters:
loop - whether the playback should be looped or not.
amp - the amplitude scaling
outBus - the index of the first bus to play on
fadeTime - the time in seconds for the synth to fade in and out (upon release())
Returns:
the buffer playing synth. when not looping, the synth is automatically freed when the buffer playback is complete.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs in message sending
Warning:
requires prior UGenInfo.readDefinitions

play

public Synth play(boolean loop,
                  float amp,
                  int outBus,
                  float fadeTime,
                  Node target,
                  int addAction)
           throws IOException
Plays the buffer contents.

Parameters:
loop - whether the playback should be looped or not.
amp - the amplitude scaling
outBus - the index of the first bus to play on
fadeTime - the time in seconds for the synth to fade in and out (upon release())
target - to node to add the new synth to
addAction - the add action to use when adding the synth
Returns:
the buffer playing synth. when not looping, the synth is automatically freed when the buffer playback is complete.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs in message sending
Warning:
requires prior UGenInfo.readDefinitions
